nodes.bodyText: Perhaps we could remove all these deprecated methods because the majority of user agents do not implement these?

I kept these deprecated methods just in case.
I agree to remove these methods. Any thoughts @trustin?
Are these used in real world? If so, we should keep them. Otherwise, +1 for removal.
Let me search the usage of these fields on GitHub.
The creation-date and modification-date seem to be only used in email MIME. Otherwise, it is rarely used. I will remove the deprecated fields.
OK.
Should we raise an exception or fall back to ISO-8859-1?

There might be no strong restriction in RFC 6266. https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6266#section-4.3
I think we can fall back to ISO-8859-1.

Sorry for this part. I have just read RFC5987(https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5987#section-3.2.1). It says:

Producers MUST use either the "UTF-8" ([RFC3629]) or the "ISO-8859-1"
([ISO-8859-1]) character set.  Extension character sets (mime-
charset) are reserved for future use.

Is it better to limit the supported charsets to "UTF-8" and "ISO-8859-1" only?
Yes, please. :-)
Probably better returning null, like contentType() does?
